title: [CFI] Add `Rotate` button to receipt modal

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.60-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** SRAM (CC: @JmillsExpensify @dannymcclain) **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#customer-chat](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/CAS1DND4H/p1763400109094729) ## Action Performed: 1. Go to global create > Create expense > Scan 2. Take a picture of a receipt 3. Click on the receipt thumbnail OR 1. Go to an expense with a receipt 2. Click the receipt thumbnail ## Expected Result: _This is a new feature. One that exists in Classic, but hasn't been added to NewDot yet._ - Add a rotate icon to the receipt modal - When clicked, rotate the receipt image 90 degrees and save it automatically. ## Actual Result: N/A, there is no rotate feature in the app. ## Workaround: Yes, either use the feature available in the OS or switch to Classic. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.60-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2009/folder/13176686/41236628/1022756569 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2082@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Have two accounts opened on two different devices or environments. Prerequisite 2: User A has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat. 3. Tap on header and select "Members" 4. Invite User B to workspace chat. 5. Return to chat. 6. Create a manual expense. 7. As User B, navigate to workspace chat. 8. Open the expense created by User A. 9. Note that infinite loading is experienced. ## Expected Result: Member of workspace chat should be able to open expenses created by admin. ## Actual Result: Infinite loading is experienced when opening an expense as member of workspace chat. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7d473e9a-632a-4bbe-90ed-741de3e21721 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [RCA #72923] Bank Account - Manual setup screen is shown after restarting the Plaid flow

labels.name: Reviewing

labels.name: Weekly

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:**  9.2.59-3
**Reproducible in staging?:** Y
**Reproducible in production?:** Unable to validate in Prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/72923
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+ag131125@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team


## Action Performed:
Precondition: Use an Expensifail account with no bank account previously set
1. Launch the Expensify app
2. Create a workspace
3. Change the currency to USD if needed
4. Enable Expensify Card
5. Go to the Expensify Card tab > Issue new card
6. Tap on Log into your bank
7. Go through the Plaid flow until you reach the "What's your legal name? screen
8. Enter the following data:
First name: Alberta
Last name: Charleson
9. Tap on Next
10. Tap several times on the back arrow at the top left until you reach the "Add bank account" screen
11. Tap on Continue setup > Confirm

## Expected Result:
The "What's your date of birth?" is displayed

## Actual Result:
The "Manually add your bank account" setup screen is displayed

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [x] Android: App
- [x] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
- [ ] MacOS: Desktop
